title: NRW, Emeco play it cool as bids due for BGC Contracting
text:
There's a pair of Australian listed companies hanging around the hoop at up-for-sale mining and construction contractor BGC Contracting.

While there's plenty of games being played, it is understood sale adviser Macquarie Capital is taking shortlisted parties through late-stage due diligence this week, ahead of binding offers which are expected to be worth a few hundred million dollars.

BGC Group founder Len Buckeridge died in 2014. John Mokrzycki

ASX-listed Emeco is understood to have been in the data room in recent weeks, keen to work out exactly how buying one of its big customers could help its own financial situation. Sources told this column on Tuesday that while Emeco had not withdrawn, its interest had cooled with the company particularly worried about BGC Contracting's construction arm.

Also around the auction is fellow listed contractor NRW Holdings, although its interest is from outside the process. Sources said NRW was cut from the auction after the indicative bid phase last month, told its offer wasn't high enough.

However, it has made it clear to BGC and its advisers that it continues to see logic in acquiring at least parts of BGC Contracting. Similarly it's understood Macquarie is keeping NRW at close call on the basis it could be re-engaged if other indicative offers aren't firmed up.
description: There's two Australian companies hanging around at up-for-sale mining and construction contractor BGC Contracting.
